intro: Wulffia maculata var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the spotted wulffia, is a member of the Boraginaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its hairy, upright stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The flowers are typically blue or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds.
